result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (10th or More) and Operating w/ PAC (10th+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (10th or More) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (10th+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason W. Belisle was found guilty of OWI (10th or More), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court sentences DEF 12 years prison 6 years initial confinement followed by 6 years extended supervision, consecutive to Burnett County case 10cf11.    fine/costs $1769.00 , Reimburse county for blood draw $23.45,  revoke dl 3 years plus 6 years   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.  IID for 3 years   On any vehicle owned or operated.  effective after release from prison. DEF is eleigible for both programs.

records.addlTxt: FROM THE DEFENDANT
From the Defendant
Sentencing Hearing held on March 16, 2015
ro Amend Judgment of Conviction from 12 year sentence to 11 years  6 years initial confinement followed by 5 years on extended supervision.

Defendant Jason W. Belisle in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Jason W. Belisle in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. all parties viewed PSI report - no additions or corrections, recess while parties confer new agreement 8 yrs 5 and 3;  Court sentences DEF 12 years prison 6 years initial confinement followed by 6 years extended supervision, consecutive to Burnett County case 10cf11.    fine/costs statutory minimum, Reimburse county for blood draw $23.45,  revoke dl 3 years plus 6 years   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.  IID for 3 years   On any vehicle owned or operated.  effective after release from prison.    conditions of extended supervision - AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations,   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.    Absolute Sobriety, DEF is eligible for Challenge and Earned Release.
(scanned & distributed)
Of Sentencing hearing held on 12-22-14 Before Judge Gerald Wright, DA Bruce Poquette on behalf of the State, Defendant in person w/atty. Thomas W. Duffy.
Stanley Correctional

Defendant Jason W. Belisle in court in custody with attorney Thomas W Duffy.   Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; advised of rights; Defendant pleads NC; Court finds Guilty and convicts on Ct. 1; Ct. 2 is dismissed and read in.  PSI ordered by the court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Stanley Correctional
From Jason stating he is now at Stanley Correctional.

Defendant Jason W Belisle in court, in custody by phone with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for Sawyer County.
DE advised of rights, waives preliminary hearing.   DE will need to appear in person for next hearing, as parties plan to have plea at that time.  Arraignment scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

DEF does not appear, he was transported to prison.  Attorney Thomas W Duffy in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference set for 10-31-14 @ 10:30 am to discuss preliminary hearing.

Defendant Jason W. Belisle in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Jason W. Belisle in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint via attorney.  DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 11:00 am.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Daily Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the daily testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.

DEF Jason Belisle appears in court, in custody by video.  Bruce Poquette appears for the State of WI.  Probable cause is found. Court orders $1000 cash bond with Special Bail Bond Conditions, DAILY testing, not random. DEF to contact public defender's office.  Initial Appearance scheduled for 9-02-14 @ 8:30 am.
